data.title: Rice University
data.meta_description: Patrick Randolph (6) WR - CLIP FILE: Former Paul W. Bryant player making impact at Rice(10/16/09) Bio PDF Format 2010 Put together one of his finest games in...
data.text:
CLIP FILE:

Former Paul W. Bryant player making impact at Rice(10/16/09)

Bio PDF Format

2010

Put together one of his finest games in his final appearance at Rice Stadium... Caught all four passes in the second half, including three for 42 yards on the Owls' two scoring drives in the fourth quarter, including a 17-yarder on third and 17 from the UAB 20, to keep an eventual 19-play, 83-yard march alive... Had nine catches for 160 yards and two touchdowns in the final four games... Opened the Owls' scoring against Tulsa with a career-long, 50-yard reception on Rice's second play from scrimmage...Carried a reverse for a career-best rush of 35 yards to help set up the Owls' first touchdown against UCF... Grabbed a season-high four passes for 52 yards against SMU.

2009

Caught a career-high eight passes for 92 yards (also a career high) and a pair of touchdowns at SMU... Had 29 catches over the last eight games... Second on the team with a career-best 39 catches, 356 yards and four TD catches.

2008

Caught 12 passes in the first five games before an ankle sprain hampered him down the stretch ... made his first career start against SMU and scored his first career touchdown, a 35-yard pass from Chase Clement, the first of a school-record 41 that Clement would throw during the regular season ... caught his second TD of the season vs. North Texas.

2007

Finished the year with 142 all-purpose yards and averaged 17.8 yards per touch ... saw his first action against Baylor and carried the ball 21 yards on a reverse for his first career carry and added eight yards on one rush against Texas ... caught his first career pass, good for seven yards, against Texas Tech .. also returned four kickoffs for a total of 71 yards, with a long return of 22 coming against Texas.

2006

Redshirt.

Paul W. Bryant High School

2006 graduate of Paul W. Bryant High in Tuscaloosa, Ala. ... two-year starter and three-year letterman as a two-way player for coach Scott Booth ... helped the Stampede to the state playoffs as a senior ... earned a pair of player of the week honors for his play against Tuscaloosa Central (WVUA) and Northridge (Athlete's Foot) ... holds Bryant school records for a 97-yard TD run and his 13.6 yards per carry average on the season ... had 25 tackles and two interceptions on defense ... on offense, had 20 catches for 251 yards and four touchdowns, and 250 yards and two TDs on 19 rushing attempts ... in track, holds Bryant school records in the high jump (6-10) and long jump (22-2 1/2) ... named all-state in the high jump in 2005 and 2006 ... had a 3.3 high school GPA.

Personal

Full Name: Patrick Arneze Randolph ... Born: June 7, 1988, at Memphis, Tenn. ... Parents: Paul and Mia Randolph, Tulsa (one sister) ... Father played football at Tennessee Martin and for Winnipeg and Montreal in the CFL; father is now Associate Head Coach/Defensive Coordinator at Tulsa ... Rice major: history ... Hanszen College.
